it.polimi.se2018.model

Class Round

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2018.model.Round

  • public class Round
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a single Round, with the playersIDs in the order they have to play in the round
    Author:
    Emilio Imperiali

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Round changeRound()
      This method builds the next array playersOrder and gives it to the costructor of the next round with the new roundNumber Used by Controller to start a new round
      void changeTurn()
      This method is called when a player ended his turn and you need to change player with the following player
      void denyNextTurn()
      Used by ToolCardController because RunningPliers toolCard needs it to allow the player to place the die twice and skip your second turn this method, specifically, let the player skip his second turn (deleting the player from the second half of the array) note that the toolcard must set hasPlacedDie and hasUsedCard requires being in the first half of the array. if not, toolcards throws an exception
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o) 
      int getCurrentPlayerIndex() 
      java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getPlayersOrder() 
      int getRoundNumber() 
      int hashCode() 
      boolean isFirstRotation()
      Used by ToolCardController because RunningPliers can be used only by a player that is performing his second turn of the round
      boolean isLastTurn() 
      boolean isYourTurn(Player player)
      Used by Controller to check if it's the turn of a player that wants to perform a move

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, finalize, getClass, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayersOrder

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getPlayersOrder()
        Returns:
        the array of playersIDs representing the order of the players

      • getCurrentPlayerIndex

        public int getCurrentPlayerIndex()
        Returns:
        the index of the array playersOrder

      • getRoundNumber

        public int getRoundNumber()
        Returns:
        the number of this round

      • isYourTurn

        public boolean isYourTurn(Player player)
        Used by Controller to check if it's the turn of a player that wants to perform a move
        Parameters:
        player - is the player whom you want to know if it's his turn
        Returns:
        true if it's player's turn, false otherwise

      • isFirstRotation

        public boolean isFirstRotation()
        Used by ToolCardController because RunningPliers can be used only by a player that is performing his second turn of the round
        Returns:
        true if we are in the first rotation of the round, false otherwise

      • isLastTurn

        public boolean isLastTurn()
        Returns:
        true if it's the last turn of the round, false otherwise

      • changeTurn

        public void changeTurn()
        This method is called when a player ended his turn and you need to change player with the following player

      • changeRound

        public Round changeRound()
        This method builds the next array playersOrder and gives it to the costructor of the next round with the new roundNumber Used by Controller to start a new round
        Returns:
        the next Round

      • denyNextTurn

        public void denyNextTurn()
        Used by ToolCardController because RunningPliers toolCard needs it to allow the player to place the die twice and skip your second turn this method, specifically, let the player skip his second turn (deleting the player from the second half of the array) note that the toolcard must set hasPlacedDie and hasUsedCard requires being in the first half of the array. if not, toolcards throws an exception

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - it's the object that user wants to know if it's equal to this Round
        Returns:
        true if o it's equals to this, false otherwise

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
